p: Personal protective equipment is important for infection control in the dental clinic, particularly considering that splatter/droplets contain potential saliva‐borne pathogens. Protective goggles or face shields, masks, gloves, and caps should be regularly worn by the practitioner. When in the epidemic period of contagious diseases such as SARS and COVID‐19, transmission‐based precautions (Figure 1a), including additional protective outwear, surgical mask/N95 respirator and shoe covers, should be adopted by the practitioner to avoid potential droplet/aerosol transmission (Meng et al., 2020; Samaranayake & Peiris, 2004).
